reviews.review: Bucket list item. Went to St Petersburg for business. Was invited to an opera, wasn't really interested in the opera but decided to go. Glad I did. Each play is a unique act performed by many talented humans
Ballet. The evening in the Mariinsky theatre is always delightful. This time together with my friend we were watching the evening if the short ballets. Breath-taking and definitely worth seeing!

BE SURE WHICH BALLET YOUR TOUR IS ATTENDING. We were passengers on the Noordam and paid a huge amount to attend the Russian ballet at this theatre. The pictures in the brochure etc showed girls in classical white ballet dresses, but we got a stark black and red production of a version of Carmen, with dancing and cheap sets which looked like a production from an old movie,The second short ballet involved two people, a chair and mime.the theatre itself has impossible seating on the flat lower area. Seats are one behind the other, and all on one level, so if you are more than two or three rows back, you can see very little. Our vision was blocked 85-95%.Get seats on an upper level.Toilets are up stairs, there are very few toilets and long queues, so not sure what you do if you have a bladder problem!We were appalled that Holland America did not make it clear what the seating and programme were. We felt ripped-off all round!

Worlds best ballet don't miss it. Rated worlds best ballet ensemble. You don't have to know ballet to be intrigued by these highly professional ballet dancers.Lovingly restored house for ballet and opera.Can easily be reached by a nice stroll along Griboyedov canal from Nevsky Prospekt. Be aware the ensemble has holiday in July and August. During summer visiting ballet and opera groups from other cities perform.No dress code.Foreigners pay double price for tickets. Don't try to fool the staff by paying domestic tickets. They will catch you. I have tried.You can buy tickets on the Internet or in special shops selling tickets for all cultural events. Your hotel might be able to help you. Sell outs are common. Try to plan in advance If you want to enrich your soul with fantastic ballet.Same ticket prices wherever you buy the tickets.

Fascinating!. The Mariinsky Theatre is a historic theatre of opera and ballet (called the Mariinsky Ballet and Mariinsky Opera) and home to Mariinsky Orchestra in Saint Petersburg. It became the preeminent music theatre of late 19th century in Russia. Tchaikovsky, Mussorgsky, and Rimsky-Korsakov premiered their stage masterpieces here.The Mariinsky Ballet is the resident classical ballet company of the Mariinsky Theatre. A few years after the first Russian dance school, the Imperial Theatre School, began in 1738, the Mariinsky Ballet started. It is one of the world's leading ballet companies owned a leading international ballet school, the Vaganova Ballet Academy. Tonight we did enjoy the Ballet show (Don Quixote) and sensed the magnificent atmosphere.

Not to be missed. It’s as posh and Imperial as it gets. Built in neoclassical style, the theatre’s facades are monumental, sharp and aristocratically chilled. This impression changes as its interior decor turns into a sheer delight. Once in, you’ll notice yourself a part of a multicultural beau monde eager to be amazed. Just a few minutes into a performance you’ll see a change in the eyes and faces of people around you. A grumpy looking grey-haired man in a tuxedo will vigorously clap, exclaiming “Bravo, bravo!”, and a northern beauty with slightly cold features will gently smile through tears. It was here that famous prima-ballerina Anna Pavlova, at the age of 8, chose her destiny after watching “The Sleeping Beauty” for the first time in her life. And it was here where she danced her debut.Book tickets for opera or ballet in advance as they are highly desirable and it’s very common to spot theatre-lovers desperately inquiring for an extra ticket at the entrance, just minutes away from performances.

An experience. If you like ballet you will probably come to Pieter just to come here, as this is the temple of classical ballet. Tickets are quite expensive, but it's worth the cost to come over, the theatre itself is a museum and it's one of those "once in a lifetime experiences" that given the chance is good to have.

Great opera with English subs. Just saw Evgeni Onegin. The singers and the decorations are incredible. There is a screen above the stage with English subs so you can actually know what are they singing about. The theatre itself is breathtaking.

A relic of faded elegance. Booked tickets for a ballet and particularly wanted to go to the original theatre and not the new one next door. The ballet itself was amazing, but although we had mid priced seats, because of how the boxes are organised, but the time people who knew better had organised their chairs, we could barely see. So an immense disappointment and we would probably have been better going to the modern theatre. Apart from the theatre itself, the interval cafe was a delightful relic of days gone by.

Historic ballet hall. This hall was one of the reasons we went to Russia, and the seats and the performance did not disappoint. It was more than wonderful - it was heavenly. You just cannot find the quality of Russian ballet elsewhere. Then when you hold it in a historic hall such as the Mariinsky, with such wonderful acoustics, seating and atmosphere, it makes a night to remember. Get your tickets on line, so you can get good seats. The hotels have seats, but normally not very good ones. It is a memorable evening - never to be forgotten!

Wonderful experience. This was my first ballet experience and I thought it was lovely. The production was Swan Lake, which was fantastic and set in a grand theatre full of gilding and chandeliers. Tickets were easy to obtain via the theatre web site and can be printed at home with-out any problems. The ballet had 4 acts and there was an intermission after 2 & 3. Reasonable priced snacks and drinks can be purchased at the bar. If your in SPB and have the opportunity 'just Do it'.
Wonderful evening experience. Impressive set up, full of glamour. Pleasant evening out with friends and dinner afterwards. Visiting theatre while in St. Petersburg is a must.

Beautiful facility to attend the ballet. We were fortunate enough to see a ballet at the Marinskiy Theatre during our visit to St. Petersburg. We were part of a President's Cruise on the Celebrity Silhouette and the ballet, The Bronze Horseman, was a complimentary event. We saw the ballet in the new theatre which is a beautiful modern facility. The original theatre remains a functional theatre and it was beautiful and imposing from the outside.

What an experience. Firstly, the ticketing from the website was very efficient and we could plan ahead. The performance of Giselle was beautiful. The dancers are the best, even the corps de ballet . The extra opportunity to get an autograph afterwards made the evening unforgettable.

Ballet at its best. For anyone who loves Ballet the Mariinskiy Theatre is a must . This is traditional Russian ballet at its best. On the evening of our attendance we saw La Bayadere in a beautiful production. Tickets can be purchased online ahead of time and they are not as expensive as, say, the La Scala Theatre or the Metropolitan.The architecture of the theatre is exquisite and the stage is huge so it gives the possibility of creating lavish productions. And do not miss the bar on the mezzanine floor with champagne and huge, delicious red caviar or smoked salmon tartines.

L'exilir d'amore. Fantastic experience. We were lucky to find tickets from the theatre web site - which is really good and friendly. The majority of the audience was local very well dressed. The performance fantastic.

Wonderful evening in an elegant stunning setting. We had a fantastic evening at this beautiful theatre. We were not as concerned with what performance we saw, we primarily wanted to experience the majesty and ambience of the old theatre itself. So that we had good seats and didn’t miss out we made sure we booked tickets in advance. We booked through the website: Mariinsky-Theatre.com. This website emailed us when the playbill was available, about three months in advance, and provided a discount when booking. Although the tickets were pricey we had great seats and return taxi rides were included in our ticket price. We were in the original Mariinsky Theatre which was stunning. It was a wonderful experience to be able to sit in this ornate, elegant gilded theatre. Our seats were Belle Etage Box 12, Row 1, Seat 1 and 3, right next to the original Tsar’s box which was not in use. We were in the front row of the box and had a great view of the whole stage. Although our seats were odd numbers we were seated together. The seats themselves were quite firm and not very comfortable. Something to be mindful of when booking tickets is the majority of the theatre has flat seating, not tiered, making viewing difficult if you have someone tall in front of you. Before the performance, we went to the café on the second floor for a nice pre theatre drink. While there we also arranged to reserve a table for intermission with pre ordered drinks and caviar sandwiches which were waiting for us when we arrived.There was not a ballet being performed during our stay so we saw the opera “L’Elisir D’Amore” by Gaetano Donizetti. It was performed in Italian with Russian subtitles. A wonderful evening in a stunning setting. Would definitely recommend a visit.
Good, very precise, attractive performance.. Good, very precise, attractive performance. (Ballet: Giselle)Very big stage, traditional atmosphere!Is offer for all visitors!

Great opera!. A great theatre for opera and ballet lovers. The theatre ( the old building ) is gorgeous itself. We watched " The Flying Dutchman" by Wagner. The sinopsis and the translation of the text on the upper board was only in Russian. So for foreigners it may be better to watch a ballet. A Very good experience.

A really great experience for ballet lovers. I was surprised when I came to book for the Marinskiy Ballet that the programme was not released until quite late. The prices from the booking agents seemed quite high and knowing that you pay about an extra third when using agents in London I tried to see how to book with the theatre directly but without speaking Russian it seemed impossible. Unfortunately we were away when the programmed was released but the company I had chosen to book through was still offering discounts. As it was a once in a lifetime experience we wanted good seats. We were confined by our dates on our visas, so the only ballets available were Don Quixote and the graduation performance by Marinsky students at 1200. We also booked opera tickets for Marinskiy 2.The booking company offered us complementary taxis to and from the performances, which turned out to be very useful, as our biggest hassles in St Petersburgh were with taxi drivers, even worse than the crowds, we took to the buses in the end!!We had seats in the front row second tier middle to side boxes, so an excellent view of the stage and orchestra. I was surprised by the horse and donkey that brought Don Quioxote and Pancho Sanchez onto the stage, they behaved exceeding well. I was also surprised by the chorus of children who danced on points, Google tells me that they start in Russia at the age of 8.There were some amazing dancers and the whole production was excellent as were the orchestra, 6 double bases for Don Quioxote and sets. The 2 x half hour intervals did extend the performances somewhat, though we enjoyed our prosecco and salmon caviar during the evening performance interval. We would have had the caviar again at the lunch time performance but they had run out but the time we arrived at the front of the queue.I did keep our tickets to work out what the agent's mark up was, but life's too short and we had enjoyed the experience very much. The theatre is so typical of that era with its scalloped boxes.

A classic offcourse!. You can get a taste of former imperialism, especially if you choose to go to a classical ballet like "La Bajadere" or "Sleeping Beauty" etc. Not all the seats offer a good view to tha stage. If you sit far, don't worry - get a pair of binoculars from the cloakroom!

Great opera, but incredibly rude staff!. The whole idea of going to Mariinsky Theatre was to treat my parents, my husband and my mother-in-law to an unforgettable opera performance in the heart of Saint Petersburg for which we travelled all the way from Ireland. The theatre itself is of course spectacular and performance was amazing! But! And a huge and very upsetting but! I accidentally printed out the wrong page for my tickets (since I ordered them online in Ireland), but instead of helping me to get the right page or even assist me in any way in trying to figure out the issue, the woman working on the day in the ticket window abused me, then accused me of purchasing my tickets God knows where, she continued being incredibly rude to me despite seeng that I was in total shock and terribly upset by the whole situation, she then threw the page I printed out into my face and sent me rudely off to an administrator who first didn't really want to help me despite me showing her that I had definitely purchased and most importantly paid for my tickets. She only decided to help when she heard me saying that we were from Ireland, which shouldn't really matter as all customers should be appreciated. At the end, the matter was resolved and we attended the amazing performance, but an unpleasant impression unfortunately is going to stay with us for a very long time.

Worldwide renown house of opera and ballet !. Unfortunately we weren't so lucky to get the tickets for some perfomance here in this famous Mariinskiy Theatre, as we did in the case of Bolshoi Theatre in Moscow. However been pleased to walk in this theatre quarter, that is, in the area between Dekabrists Street, Theatre Square, Glinka Street and water body of Kriukov Canal.Looked at the very nice building of theatre, nicely coloured in white and light green, with the decorative columns on the front facade, high windows. Also read the affiches for the announcements of the operas, ballets.This Mariinskiy Theatre is above all known by setting on the stage the masterpieces of Tchaikovsky, Mussorgsky and Rimsky - Korsakov.During the Soviet era, the theatre was known under the name of Kirov Theatre.Maybe some other time we'll chance to get ourselves within this temple of the beautiful art.

Beautiful ballets. I enjoyed the Mid Summer Night Dream ballet very much although I m not a big ballet fans. Booked my balcony ticket in advance which avoided disappointment. Not particular dresscode but I realised Russian ladies dress up all the time even walk outdoor in the mud.

World-class dancers, ghastly sets. We went to see La Sylphide--the dancers were absolutely magnificent, every single one of them but the sets were just ghastly. The Scottish set in the first part is so kitsch with bambis on the walls, kilts, sporrans, and all that it makes your eyes hurt (try a fouetté sauté wearing a long kilt and sporran). The second part in the forest was not so bad, you felt the decorator of the first set had died from exposure to his own terrible taste and been replaced by an obsessive compulsive who thought that a hundred trees could not possibly be enough (surprisingly enough he stopped at squirrels, owls et al.). Why on earth are producers allowed to torture dancers (and singers) with their abominable "ideas"? When will they be put in their proper place as humble SERVANTS of the real artists? Not every one can be a Peter Brook. The inside of the theatre is in splendiferous, over-the-top, putti-ridden, gilt-to-death XIXth Century taste.

Swan Lake but how did I pay so much?. A beautiful theatre and it was a wonderful production. We booked the tickets on the Web and they were eye watering in price. The face value though was reasonable. So how come we were charged hundreds? Apart from that it was a fabulous evening very comfortable seats and the caviar sandwiches worth trying.

Superb !!. We were so fortunate to get tickets to see the Ballet Cinderella ...This production was brilliant........The dancers were extraordinary......The choreography was amazing!!! The performace was flawless!!Though we believed this to be more suited for a young audience it was so sophisticated and really more suited for the mature... Russian ballet has a well deserved reputation as the BEST !! The discipline and artistry of the dancers was extraordinary.... The music enchanting!!What an experience!! We loved it!!
Good show. A beautiful theatre and we enjoyed the ballet even though I am not really a fan. Worthwhile at a relatively affordable price, but do book not he official website to avoid massive markups.

Terrific experience. An absolute must if you are in Saint Petersburg. The choreography was quite amazing. Even if you are not a ballet fan, this is a most enjoyable experience. You really do feel you are watching the best in the world. Tickets are very reasonably priced and can be purchased through your hotel.

Beautiful theater, BUT!!!!. Beautiful historic theater, definitely visit. The Mariinsky complex consists of three main theaters; the other two (Mariinsky II and the Concert Hall) are modern, excellent halls. The original theater unfortunately has major problems if you actually want to see a ballet there. I saw three ballets in this theater on my recent visit, and all three (at the top-level prices, I might add) had uncomfortable seats and terrible nightlines. The final night, I was in the center of the orchestra 8th row, and my view was 85% blocked -- I could not see anything on the center stage at all. Sitting there, unable to see ANYTHING, I got so frustrated that I went to management at intermission and asked for a refund. The Mariinsky is OK charging foreigners 3x the price Russians pay, but it is not OK providing any of the customer service that would normally be assumed by people paying the highest price for tickets. This is really unfortunate, as the ballet company is arguably the best in the world, and everything about the performance is fabulous -- but it doesn't do you any good if you can't see, and the theater's management more or less told me to go tell it to Stalin, whereupon I canceled my plans to revisit next year.If you are seeing a non-visual performance there, it will be fine, as long as you don't mind being uncomfortable.

Ballet Tripple. Our first ever visit to the Ballet and what a treat to see three separate and different performances in one night. Apollo, The Prodigal Son and Firebird. We would like to thank the unfortunate person who had to cancel their visit and our good fortune of being on the second row of the Royal Box. Our view was superb. The performances were amazing and each one providing novices such as us with a window into an art that is truly addictive. As for the historical Mariinsky it was everything you would expect to accompany this age old art form. The acoustics made you tingle as the orchestra performed flawlessly, I could almost hear every individual instrument play. During the intervals we drank wine and didn't have to queue for long. This was an amazing experience.

A beautiful theatre with sublime ballet. The performance of La Bayadere that I saw was second to none (and that included Nureyev when he first brought the great pas de deux to the West and performed it with Margot Fonteyn. Both the three lead dancers and the corps de ballet were faultless and the mis-en-scene was lovely.

splendid building, impressing ballet. We went to the Swan Lake ballet and thoroughly enjoyed the performance and the beautiful building. I'm not really a ballet lover but everyone should try this when staying in St Petersburg. It's an unforgettable experience, not to be missed.
Ballet. The Mariinsky is an absolute must visit when in St.Petersburg. The theatre itself is already worth the visit and the performances are renowned.
Ballet at its best.. A dream come true. So beautiful inside and out.Fantastic ballet with a wonderful orchestra.Have been dreaming of this visit for a long time and it did not disappoint.

Must visit. This is my favorite theatre to visit. Every time I'm in Saint-Petersburg I always visit it. Usually I go there to see the classical Nutcracker Russian ballet in winter, just before the New Year and Christmas - it has a beautiful, magnificent atmosphere and every time I just don't want to leave this little magical world. Usually the best seats are in parter first rows or near the stage, even though the attraction is not cheap it is worth spending every rouble.

excellent performance - a must do for music lovers. We saw the opera Eugene Onegin which was wonderful. I bought tickets on-line prior to leaving the UK which worked great and the tickets were delivered to our hotel.The seats are basic wooden chairs and do get a little hard after a while but the setting of the old theater is wonderful.

Wonderful theatre & performance. Visited here in January to see the ballet Giselle which was excellent! The theatre is also beautiful and well worth a visit. Very disappointed with the programme we purchased which was basically the size of an A4 piece of paper folded in half! Definitely a must when visiting St Petersburg!

Breathtaking - highly recommended if you like ballet. Saw "The Nutcracker" just in time for Christmas. Amazing dancers and sets!! The theater itself is also beautiful! Just one thing to look out for when reserving seats... If you reserve seats on the sides of the theater in the last row in a box (only 3 rows in a box), there're chandeliers that block a bit of the stage view. On the other hand, these seats are elevated, so you can see over people's heads.

What an experience. Enjoyed Don Quixote ballet, and absolutely loved it. Interesting sets, intimate setting in the theater, orchestra was terrific and the ballet wonderful. This coming from a relatively 'unrefined' American. It truly was a once in a lifetime experience and well worth the visit to St. Petersburg.
Opera - Mazepa. Building and concert hall amazing... staff friendly.. opera had english subtitles - extra point earned.
Culturally relevant. The ballet may not have been what I was most interested in, but I did learn about how culturally diverse the city was.

Mariinsky theatre - the soul of St. Petersburg. Тo be in St. Petersburg and not visit the Mariinsky theatre, the same that ignore the Hermitage. Mariinsky theatre - the pride of the city. Here are the famous Russian artists and world stars. An evening spent in this beautiful place, may be the best romantic memories from visiting the city. If you want to get on a sold-out performance, buy your tickets in advance via the theatre's website.
Ballet of superlatives. So you want to see the best classic ballet of the world? Here you are! Any day, any show, you can't make a mistake.
Peerless Theatre!. Peerless theatre.The possibilities of enjoying ballet in the classic version.Beautiful Opera and ballet Russian school! Ulyana Lopatkina is my favorite.All lovers of the classics!

Such A Magical Performance. We had the chance to watch the Nutcracker ballet in the old Mariinsky Theatre on our honeymoon. It was beyond our expectations. The theatre was magnificent, and the performance couldn't be more perfect. It even put my husband in awe. We bought the tickets from the theatre's official website. It was quite pricey for the dress circle, but it was totally worth it.

A night with the Swan's.... Really wanted to experience a night at the historical Mariinsky theatre.However the chosen Ballet was on at Marriinsky 2.Only open for the last 2 year's and quite impressive it was too.Never attended a ballet before as i thought it would bore me to sleep.How wrong i was.I was mesmerised from the opening scene until the Encores.Swan lake was the chosen ballet and we had good seat's and view and the acoustic's were excellent.This revered ballet company put on a splendid show and the fact that a guy from the North of England played the Prince just added to the wonderment.The lead Ballerina was the obvious star of the show and a great night was had.Next visit to St Petes will include a night in THE Mariinsky.....Ballet ? ...Must be done when in St Petes.

Always Book direct with the Theatre. As we are in St Petersburg I'll book the Ballet and see the Kirov says the Lady wife and she did. two seats in a box overlooking the Stage at a price from the Opera and Ballet site than had me gasp. She accepted it was very expensive but would pay it. Thankfully she had second thoughts and we went to Don Quixote and sat in the same box, four seats away from that booking by booking Marinsky Theatre on the .ru site and conducting business in English. The ticket were e mailed on booking and the price mere 2000 roubles per ticket. The show itself was all that it should be with the world's leading Dancers and the experience even had us booking two tickets for the Perm Ballet in Dublin later this Month.Moral "Be confident enough to try the local site not just the one the Tourist will be presented with as first choice it can and often does cost you.

Fabulous Sleeping Beauty. We booked tickets to see Sleeping Beauty at Mariinsky 2 online before our visit to St Petersburg. Well worth doing this to avoid problems later! Hoped to be able to visit original Mariinsky theatre when we called for our tickets at the ticket office but it was not possible! Ticket office was already quite busy at opening time and only one lady was on duty! Mariinsky 2 is a fabulous new theatre. Comfortable seating!! Not too hot! We had a marvellous view! Ballet was absolutely outstanding and musicians played wonderfully. Amazing to be able to walk into town past Tchaikovsky's house!! No obvious cafe or bars here (although we may not have found them) so it would be wise to take a bottle of water with you if the management do not mind! Fabulous displays of original costumes in hall foyer. This visit to see Kirov was the icing on the cake for our visit to St Petersburg!

Night at the opera . Very petty place. The chairs were a bit small but we made it fine. The opera was over the top vocals and costumes. Wow loves that kinda stuff while I missed the game. But still was a very special night for the 2 of us

Gizel..... My husband told me that this was last ballet expirience....
The place beautiful.
But very hot inside.
May be opera will be better there
.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Poorest service I have ever seen in a theatre. Yes, this place has great history. They still have some amazing performances. They claim to have one of the best conductors in the world (which is true from my point of view). But opera singers are rather poor with very few exceptions like Semenchuk and Aksionov. The most disappointing is the overall service and convenience of all services like cafes, toilets and cloak rooms. Really little thought about the visitors.
Wow. Watched Bachisaray Fountains balet. This is really amazing. Music, dances, decorations, costumes.Old classical Russian theater, it is in pair to Bolshoy in Moscow.
beautiful theater. Mariinsky is beautiful, and theres many options on operas ballets and concerts, with very good price range depending on seats.No dressing code.

The New Mariinskiy Theatre. This is a modern theatre with wonderful acoustics, very near the old theatre. We saw The ballet Romeo and Juliet it was a most magical performance. The main dancers were sublime and for Juliet it was her debut appearance as prima ballerina . The staging and costumes were brilliant. It was a most moving experience and well worth seeing.

An Unbelievable Experience!. This is the original theater which still has the royal box and lavish decor from the time of Catherine the Great. The other Mariinsky Theatre is a new and modern one. For me, this old theatre was a "must see" for a true Russian ballet experience. I was concerned that the performance might be a little cheesy in catering to tourists, but not at all. This was the best ballet production I have ever seen! There were a lot of tourists in the audience but also locals, some of whom we sat next to who were delightful. We got tickets through our tour, TJ Travel, and the seats were wonderful: 12th row, center, and for a good price. Less than what I could have bought online myself on the Theater website. Much less than what the cruise ship charges.

Tzar, Gergiev and Toyota. Conceived in the time of Catherine the Great for amusement, refined in the Soviet times as an art nearly to its limits and lavishly proliferating under maestro Gergiev who added two buildings including the newly constructed Mariinsky bigger second scene across the bridge (Mariinsky - II) and the new Concert hall boasting the Yasuhisa Toyota acoustics, which is 500 m yet further on the way, the theatre called Mariinsky has now actually three buildings capable of receiving as much spectators as a standard stadium and a good hundred of world premier performers participate annually in its festivals, contemporary and traditional ballet and opera, and other spectaculars. Tips: Tickets are available online (http://www.mariinsky.ru/), so you can feel comfortable and plan your voyage.Strollers are admitted only in the Mariinsky second scene ("Mariinski II")

amazing ballet. It was my third visit to Mariinskiy theatre and once again we've chosen to see a ballet. It was the famous Nutcracker. I enjoyed every minute of it. Everything was perfect - costumes, decorations, light and effects and, of course the harmony of dance and music. We know this music from the early childhood and I can never be tired of listening to it. Even my husband enjoyed that evening in Mariinsky theatre.Though the intermissions between the acts seemed to us a bit too long, about half an hour each.I hope it was not my last visit.By the way, the tickets can be bought on-line beforehand on the official web-site - http://www.mariinsky.ru. There is a wide range of prices.

Amazing experience. We went to two ballets on the new stage, one opera on the old state and a wonderful Gala Concert of Tchaikovsky competition. Ballet Le Corsaire and Gala Concert of Tchaikovsky competition were absolutely out this world. This place is a gem.  The new stage building is also very beautiful place to see as a piece of architecture.

Unbelievable experience. Definitely a must. If I could go again I would! Amazing atmosphere and show! I watched the La Bayadere and the professionalism, control, skills and talent deserves a standing ovation. You could feel the emotions from the ballerinas and I was so absorbed that I forgot about where I was. Truly enjoyable.
Iolanta opera. Absolutely fantastic! Iolanta on old stage: Great atmosphere, blown away by singers professionalism and talent. Would love to visit again. Food for the soul

So amazing!. I love visits to the Mariinskiy Theatre. Even though the seats are uncomfortable, and the air conditioning might not hit your section, this is a must do while in St Petersburg. The performances are only the very best, and you will get a taste of life for the elite before the Soviet years.

Now This Is Ballet. You shouldn't miss the Ballet at The Mariinsky...the old Mariinsky. Not only is the ballet second to none, but the theater itself is worth the visit. Buy the best tickets that you can afford, preferably up on the second tier on either side of the Tsar's box. This vantage point gives you a perspective on the whole stage. The intermissions give you a chance to observe (participate in) St. Petersburg's Ballet culture at its best. Champagne and caviar!

Theater Number Two. We are great fans of the ballet. The new theater is an excellent stage for performing and we had a great view. We saw three one act ballets that were only good. If you arrive early, for a hundred rubles, you can go to observation area and get an outstanding view of city.

Ballet at its best. We saw a beautiful performance of la Bayadere. Great orchestra and some spectacular solo performances. The corps de ballet were on stage for Act 3 at times 32 ballerinas in beautiful unison. Buy your tickets at the official website even with the tourist premium we got great dress circle seats at 2,300rbls. For the standard of performance very good value. Avoid the second row of the dress circle as its on same level as front row and you will be peering over and between the heads of the front row.Couldn't find a bar for the intervals. If there is one it will be tucked away. Audience mostly dresses up for the occasion. Lots of ladies in stilettos !

Gon Kihot. Well, the opera is not that famous, and I can understand why. The music is just not that good, as by Rossini, Verdi or Tchaikovsky. But still production is very modern, with use of light, projector and other special effects, scene is very impressive.And of course the theater itself is a legend, which must be seen! It is so beautiful. And you can bye good tickets for normal price.And thank you for the possibility to buy tickets in internet! the system works and it is quite user-friendly

Spectacular. I went to see the Nutcracker here and I had an outstanding experience. The production was outstanding and the hall is a beautiful building, worthy of the grandeur of St. Petersburg buildings. My ticket was 5000 Roubles and worth every penny.

Greatest theatre in Saint Petersburg. Greatest theatre in Saint Petersburg. For sure it sounds too loud but yes – one of the most interesting and oldest for sure. I’ve been here many times and on new stage and on the Old one. Recommend to be exactly at the old one – for any ballet you prefer, all of them are amazing.
Opera. I been there a busy night (mariinsky theatre 2) and seen an opera.it was not a masterpiece but the voice of actors and the decoration were great

Truely exceptional.. The quality of artists and orchestra in this world famous institution is remarkable. Buy your tickets directly from the official site on line and collect them at the box office.Best seats go for RB3200; a snip considering the quality of each performance.Shows change every night, so between the old theater and the new one, you can see something different each day. must not be missed.

Delightful ballet. If there was anything the Russians were known for during the Soviet Era, it was their ballet. Today, if you visit St. Petersburg, you want to visit this theatre because they still love their ballet. The performance we saw of "Giselle" was awesome, and the lead ballet dancer is now touring the world on a "guest performance" tour. His dancing was recently reviewed in the NYT.

Beautiful Inside & Out. This is the original Mariinski Theatre, where many of the greatest works of Russian ballet & opera were first performed. It's a magnificent building on the outside (though maybe a little in need of cleaning) and, if possible, even more magnificent on the inside. I attended five performances here between 17th May & 8th June last. Suffice it to say that, whatever they're performing, you're unlikely ever to hear a better performance, or to see a better production, anywhere, at any price. And the price of a good ticket here is just insanely low, compared to New York or Vienna.Yeah, the chairs are uncomfortable.

A Midsummer Nights Dream - Ballet . The ballet was fantastic. How could you possibly come to Russia without seeing art in action? I saw the performance on 6/21/2015. The theatre was a bit stuffy the first hour and my front row seat 28 was crammed against the wall making me a bit uncomfortable - but the ballet was so well done I overcame the discomfort. I particularly liked the performance of the fellow who played the role of 'Puck'. Everyone danced well, but he just personified and made such a delightful character. If you want a souvenir, get it at intermission because they shut everything down at the curtain call and I was unable to make a purchase. Honestly every seat has a good view in the original theatre - so get any seat that suits your budget. Enjoy!

DON'T MISS IT. This is not simply a theater, this is a temple of the art. Even if, like me, you aren't an expert you simply enjoy the virtuosos, the masters, art here doesn't need explanations, feel it

Russian Ballet at Mariinsky. Fourth row seats to see Sylvia in St. Petersburg at the beautiful old Mariinsky Theatre! What a dream come true! Beautiful production in historical theatre! Don't miss the ballet if you can possibly fit it in during your visit to St. Petersburg!

Classical ballet in a classical setting - fabulous. My husband and I went to see Swan Lake in the Mariinski Theatre, it was really superb. We were in the original theatre, it was really a superb experience. We booked through the official website - www.mariinsky.ru/en/. There is a website Mariinski.com but is NOT the official website and there is a massive commission of approx 200%. The seat plan is accurate. We booked tickets in the stalls box no 8 front row - really good. Box 10 really cramped and the side boxes were disadvantaged as people were leaning forward. The only problem was people using their phones and iPads to take pictures despite being requested to desist, very poor behaviour. The traffic was heavy on the evening we went so go early. I would really recommend a visit to the original theatre.
Great theater and performance. Saw Swan Lake during White Lights. If you are in St. Petersburg I'd highly recommend it. Beautiful architecture and helps connect you to the culture of the city.

Great performance!. I don't know much about ballet, but i truly enjoyed the performance. Don't believe their website and those who said the tickets are all sold weeks in advance. My friend and i got really good seats at RUB2,900 / ticket at the ticket office on the day of the performance. We had such a great time. It's a beautiful theater and the dancers are very professional.BTW- we also compared the prices at the Bolshoi Theater in Moscow, the prices are soooo expensive at Bolshoi. I have to admit that i don't know how's the performance at Bolshoi, but if you are like me who don't want to spend a fortune and still want to have a see a great performance, go to Mariinsky. You won't regret it!

Mariinsky is the best theatre in St. Petersburg and maybe in Russia. Every tourist who wants to see the famous Russian ballet or to listen to the opera should visit Mariinsky Theatre. It will be unforgettable impression! You can choose the performance, read about it and buy a ticket on site of Mariinsky mariinsky.ru . Almost every day 3 venues of Mariinsky offer to the spectators ballet, opera and concert- what ever one like. The great variety of repertoire can please any exquisite taste. I love Mariinsky!

World class, but dated theater. By all means, go see a performance here, it's a trip through history with world class dancers. But I can't give this place top marks as the seats are extremely uncomfortable and the sightlines are terrible. And whatever you do, go buy the tickets yourself at the theater box office. Your hotel will try to charge you 5 times the regular price. And don't buy on the internet either, where prices are even higher than the hotel. You might need to book a few days in advance, but ticket prices start at about 300 Rubles. Our hotel quoted 4,000 Rubles. I'm sure the seats were better, but I'd never pay that kind of premium. Performances are almost daily. For the record, I am not a fan of ballet, but still went just for the experience. I'm sure those who really know ballet would be in heaven here.

Wonderful performance. We spent an evening at the Ballet at the Mariinsky -- it was not only a wonderful performance but also a delightful evening. The dancers were phenomenal, and the quality of the choreography and decor second to none. Good audience, lots of people, mostly Russian, excellent atmosphere -- and it is so nice to see than in some places, people still make an effort to dress for such outings! The intervals (two) provided good opportunities for refreshments, including caviar sandwiches! (very tasty)

Beautiful place, beautiful performance. I enjoyed Shurale ballet in the beautiful Mariinsky theatre (historical building). The spirit of the place is most fascinating, it is a part of history and culture of St. Petersburg. It is so good that the building is not renovated, not changed. No artificial gold, no cheap decorations. Original, genuine piece of art. I wish that local people and guests of St. Petersburg appreciate more this beautiful and aristocratic place, and support its style by proper dress code like it is in European classical Opera houses. Too democratic style is not in harmony with the elegance of the place. Shurale ballet was a bright performance of a folk fairy tale, perfectly expressed in music and art of dancing. I cannot compare it with breaking your emotions Prokofiev's Romeo and Juliet or with magics of Chaikovsky's Nutcracker... BUT if you want to enjoy a bright and jolly holiday and feel happy and relaxed, I recommend this pretty and most attractive performance. If you want a wonderful family evening, Shurale is your choice. Not a single gloomy face! All smiling, all happy. People of all ages and cultures enjoyed that plain and lovely fairy tale thanks to great masters of dance and music of Mariinsky theater.
Ballet. We watched a fantastic Ballet, theatre was extremely beautiful and easy to walk to from central Saint Petersburg. Well worth visiting!
One of the best ballet companies in the world. Please do yourself a favor and watch a ballet at the Mariinsky. Flawless orchestra, gorgeous theater and amazing ballet.

Lovely theatre. We came here to see Verdi's Aida. My primary reason for visiting the Mariinsky was cultural, not a touristy one - claimed to be Russia's opera scene number one, I was quite expectant of the spectacle I chose. The theatre is nice, but a bit rusty, in need of a reconstruction similiar to the one Bolshoi underwent some time ago. The navigation is slightly difficult and the fact that male and female toilets are on separate floor is super annoying. On the other hand, there's an abundance of buffets in the whole building and they are highly sought after as pauses were made between each of the acts.The scene and the magnificence of the production was splendid, it's really worth seing an epic opera here. However the performance was not perfect, The singer who sung Amneris was weak until the end of the final act where she excelled and it made me even more sad about her performance: why couldn't she sing that way during the entire performance? Radames was great, the titular Aida good but also with something left to be desired. It's a pity, because I expected more and was left with less.

Simply Breathtaking. You might as well get tickets in the Tsar's Lodge, they do not cost that much more and then you sit like a king. Try to get first row though, or second. Further back your view of everything becomes too narrow, so do not take these. As for a romantic moment nothing beats this. We went to see Don Quijote. If you have not proposed to your girlfriend yet, Do it here! They should have made it easier to get drinks in pause! We stayed in the special room of the Lodge as it was rather chaotic on the outside.

The most beautiful opera house. The most beautiful opera houses I visited, in addition to extremely acoustic, I listened to the opera from a balcony, cheapest place and it was perfect. The tickets were purchased online and picked up at the ticket office with a passport just before the show. I wish I looked at some ballet.

Saint Petersburg - The mariinsky Theatre 2.. The Imperial drama, opera and ballet troupe in Saint Petersburg was established in 1783, at the behest of Catherine the Great, although an Italian ballet troupe had performed at the Russian court since the early 18th century. Two years ago the theatre got new large building just behind the historical one. The auditorium is excellent: light wood balconies, fine acoustics and superb sightlines. Within the airy interior are beige marble and Swarovski crystal lights, with backlit walls of translucent onyx and picture windows affording city views. Presently, the Company lists on its roster 22 sopranos (of which Anna Netrebko may be the best known); 13 mezzo-sopranos (with Olga Borodina familiar to US and European audiences); 23 tenors; eight baritones; and 14 basses.

Relaxed Grandeur. Even a Scottish play in Italian opera with Cyrillic subtitles is worthwhile to experience old fashioned theatre with prosecco and honeycake at the intervalAs with most Russian public places they offer a free cloakroom so you can relax for the evening in sturdy upright seatingThere was a mix of formal and casual wear

Ballet please!. Had the chance to see one of Balanchine's original works - Jewels - which was originally choreographed and shown in NYC in the late 1960's. Worth the opportunity to see a wonderful ballet in a beautiful venue.

Unforgettable evening - Swan lake ballet. Splendid performance!
During three hours, attend one of the most beautiful ballet of the world in a magnificent place.
The technique of the dancers is of flawless perfection ...
Everything comes together for an incredible evening.
I advise to book online as soon as tickets are available for sale.

A Beautiful Theatre. I came here to see Swan Lake. The ballet was amazing, the dancers are so talented, and the orchestra were great. The theatre itself is incredible, so ornate and like nothing I'd seen before. If you book tickets a few months in advance you can get very reasonable prices.

Ballet Performance. Please book the tickets on the website just after you confirmed your flight. The performance is easily fully booked. We watch a ballet dance there. The theatre itself is beautiful and the performance is good. However, since they do not have English leaflet and most of the audience is Russian. You just do not what is going on.
Magnificent Ballet Company. I saw one of the best "Swan Lakes" I have ever seen when I visited. It is my favorite ballet company in the world.

Wonderful night. What a remarkable night! We went to the ballet in the new Mariinskiy theatre and it really is a must do in St Petersburg. We managed to get seats in the Tsar's box (just booked online on the official Mariinskiy website) and the view was incredible! The dancing was so beautiful

Beautiful Theater with excellent ballet company. This theater was built in 1836 and still has the charm of that era. I saw a delightful Giselle performance and was impressed also by the knowledge of the audience which applauded during the performance when they were offered the superlative dancing. The only downside was the narrow hallways and understaffed cloak rooms which after the performance cause an ugly chaos and very very long waits for our coats.

Love of my life. I fall in love with ballet and opera since i was a kid.Mariinsky theater for me is a fantastic "church" of the art.The historical scene is a masterpiece for everybody even if you don't understand anything in ballet dance. The new scene has an awesome sound - you can hear clearly the orchestra from every part of the hall.Small life-hack - if you'are going to see the ballet - try to find the place in the middle - it's a good view of the picture of a ballet.

Excellent Theatre - Marlinsky 2. We went to a ballet in the Marlinsky Theatre 2 in St Petersburg - Beautiful views from all areas of the theatre - We were actually late and could not take our seats on the ground floor until the break - We were seated up the top of the theatre and still had a great view

Very close seating, but authentic. Balcony seats are still small wicker-seated chairs placed close together, but the Theatre has over a dozen small cafes in all parts of the building, so you don't have to worry about rushing to a main lobby for drinks or a bite to eat. Excellent choices at cafes, and every seat has a fantastic view. Highly recommended.

Still the best. After 232 years, the Mariinsky still is the gold standard by which all other ballet is measured. I love going into the old building that exudes the classical performances of days past, and now the new stage has plenty to offer in terms of acoustics, lighting and talent of the performers. Be it opera, ballet or a chamber concert, it will leave you breathless and wanting to come back again and again.

An truly exquisite experience, worth every rouble.. We were lucky enough to be here for a ballet, bought as a gift for my parents but tired out to be the highlight of our trip, although I am not a ballet expert or lover, the experience was magical, the music, the atmosphere, everything!This is a truly beautiful theatre, the staff were attentive and helpful, with English speakers keen to assist. Refreshments equivalent to London prices.Purchasing tickets was simple and very reasonable from the official theatre website, delivered as e-tickets, just present at the entrance and follow signage to your seats.Loved the whole experience, love the Russian people and their enthusiasm for the ballet.Dress smartly, the Russian audience do, it would be disrespectful to arrive in vest and shorts.

Best place to see the Real Russian Ballet !. I have never see the Russian Ballet in action, this Theater is the best place to visit for a good performance and to catch the Russian atmosphere. Even if you do not understand the Russian language , you will understand the body language of the great artist

World class opera and ballet . . .. . . . I would have killed for to see but our tour missed the season's start by 2 days. Six months before we left for Russia I starting checking the Mariinskiy theater's website. So was very disappointed not to be able to go inside. Backstage tours of Mariinskiy I were prohibitively expensive so I just learned what I could on line. Valery Gergiev is world famous and I have seen him conduct operas at the Met--so I was doubly disappointed that I could not see him in action in his theater where he is the General Artistic Director. There is a very interesting video of both buildings on line and equally interesting essays in the New York Times regarding the building of Mariinskiy II. When we actually drove by M II our St Petersburg guide called it a shopping mall, relating that most citizens of the city did not like the new building. I thought they were both beautiful--certainly different from each other. Will be sure to visit next time during the season as I am convinced Russia does ballet and opera better than most.

No wonder it is so popular among Europeans // Неудивительно, что все иностранцы в восторге!. The overall artisctic level of orchestra conduction, scenery, light, choreography and vocal is astonishing for the overwhelming majority of performances. Add a diversity of repertoir, stunning beauty of historical venue and very reasonable prices (if compared to Covent Garden, La Scala, Opera Garnier, Wiener Staatsoper and even Bolshoy Theater in Moscow) - and you get perhaps the world's greatest opera and ballet theatre!So-called "Mariinsky-2" (modern building) is highly controversial in terms of style and architecture. Choose the main stage instead.Если сравнить разнообразие репертуара, размах постановок и ценовую политику Мариинки с Венской/Миланской/Парижской операми или даже московским Большим театром, убеждаешься - из всех великих оперных театров этот - величайший)На новую сцену (т.н. "Мариинку-2") правда, не стоит соваться людям впечатлительным, остро переживающим надругательство над хорошим вкусом в архитектуре и сторонникам "РосПила" - на собственно постановке сосредоточиться не удастся.

Good experience in an opera.. The theatre it's very beatiful, with his omnipresent green, in the exterior, interiors, and in the principal room.In the rest rooms, there are exhibitions of materials and history (which is very rich) of the theatre and his representations.I went to see Tchaikovsky 's Queens of Spade and it was a very good representation.

A night at the Ballet. Awesome experience at the Ballet, the theatre is beautiful, went to see Carmen the Ballet, and another 15 minute modern production (which was a little odd), It was worth the visit just to see the ornate decorations within the theatre. Very impressive.

Try and get a ballet in. When we visited we could only get tickets to a matinee show of the firebird, and it was packed full of kids (and every so often some very well dressed couples who seemed to be surprised and irked at all the children!). It is a children's production, but it was simply magical, the dancing was really top notch and the choreography was stunning. Lovely to be present in such an historic theatre. I would recommend this wholeheartedly to any visitor

old and tired and confusing. the theatre and the ballet were both very disappointing. very few ushers, rude, more concerned that i remove my hat than helping me find my seat. and to find the seat I climbed confusing stairs three times.

A must. This was a real treat - beautiful room and wonderful ballet. Recommend seats in a box (we choose a bottom level box with front seats - terrific view) as the stalls area is all chairs on one level and very very cramped together, especially at the back as the room narrows

New concert hall. There is an old and a new Marinsky...having gone to a concert in the New, it is fabulous; didn't see the old, but it is hugely historic and a great city landmark. The Conductor is a pal of Putin so he got his sparkling new venue.

Make sure you know the difference between new stage and old stage. For ballet, this is still probably the equivalent of Mecca - perhaps only the Bolshoi in Moscow can compete, yet you'll still see some of the world's best performers here. Make sure you're aware that there are now two stages so if you wanted the classical setting, pick the old stage yet I actually found the new stage setting to be superb.
Outstanding. We had the very good fortune to see a performance of one of the best corps de ballet in Europe if not the World
Ballet. Exquisite dancing, although my preference is contemporary. The theatre should be enjoyed by attending a performance.

Worth a visit just to see the interior of the theatre. Brilliant ballet performances, excellent music in a building that is breathtaking. It is not cheap - and after a visit it is easy to see why. But they post tickets to to your hotel, and might arrange free taxi to the theatre.
The best ballet dancers. The best ballet dancers I have ever seen. A truly work class show at a cheap price, if compared to Western ballet theaters.

Worth going. My husband and I went to the Mariinsky Theater to see La Bayadere this summer. We purchased our tickets ahead of time on their website and were able to pick our seats from the seating chart. We sat in the first level of balconies in a box. The theater gets rather warm and the seats are close together, so dress accordingly. We sat knee to knee with other patrons on regular straight-backed chairs rather than what is commonly found in theaters. The orchestra and corps de ballet were phenomenal. If you have a chance either before the show or during an intermission, try to get to the small museum display on the same level as the first level of balconies. There were lovely costumes and photos from the history of the theater and its ballet troupe.One suggestion I have is to bring rubles to spend at the theater. They have beautiful snacks and drinks at the snack bar which all of the locals enjoy. In addition, if you want a program as a souvenir, you will need to buy one. There is a small but lovely gift shop as well.

Bayadere ... just magical. Bayadere is best performed by a large ballet troupe because it has a very famous dream sequence scene that requires many ballerinas to make it work well. The home of some of Russia's best ballerinas, this performance highlighted the grace of strength that only top ballerinas can muster with some wonderful pieces for the male leads also. The theatre itself is lovely and has a classical, and yet Russian, feel to it.

Ballet magic. You must book a place to go and see the Kirov Ballet at the Mariinski. We saw The Fountain of Bachinserai there and loved it. The theatre is very well-kept, the performers excellent, the orchestra perfect.
going to a ballet here is awesome. Being part of an azamara cruise, all guest were treated to the ballet. truly a night to remember. The performance and the theatre were magnificent

Great balet experience. When we planned our visit to St. Peterburg we also booked tickets for a Balet Bayadera. This was an excellent decision, but I guess it would have been the same experience with any other performance at this great establishment.

Mariinsky 2 as much an experience as the original. Going to see the Kirov ballet at the Mariinsky has to be one of life's highlights. The new Mariinsky 2 (opened in 2013), adjacent to the original, is a stunning, airy, modern building and very comfortable. Do try to go to either the ballet or opera there if you are in Saint Petersburg.

Great performance!!. We were in St. Petersburg during the White night festival in july. We saw the opera THE FLYING DUTCHMAN by Wagner. It was a great performance, wonderful soloists and choir led by the great conductor Valeri Gregeyev. The theater is beautiful, we had good seats ( ordered in advance on the internet). It was very hot that evening so we wished there was air conditioning.

Swan Lake in beautiful theater. Built in 1859, recently had spectacular refurbishment--back to splendor of the Imperial times.Swan Lake was wonderfull ballet. Not huge theater, so all seats seem good. Enjoyed Champagne and caviar at intermission---the Russian way.

The theatre you should visit!. Very nice theatre in St.Peterburg on the same level as La Scala, Grand Opera etc. Not very big but cosy atmosphere! You should book the tickets in advance to be sure you will watch the perfomance you want!
Lovely theatre.. Went to see the ballet there. Had "beletage" seats. Very comfortable. Great acoustics. Beautiful theatre.

Not to be missed!!. I have to say that attending the old Mariinsky was a supreme highlight of the trip to St. Petersburg for me and my family. The sense if history and the pride, love and support for the arts by the Russian people is practically palpable. I am sure that we took more selfies our ourselves in the theatre that night than the rest of the 5 days in the city!! My advice would be to always order tickets in advance (the summer months are especially busy and traditional Russian ballet productions sell out), always buy from the official Mariinsky website, dress up a bit for the occasion, and if in the balcony stalls, always get the front row chairs (second row is NOT raised, but third is). Yes the seats can be slightly uncomfortable, but hey, you are not on your couch at home - you're at the Mariinsky! And yes, the (yummy!) food and drink is somewhat pricey compared to City Grill Express, but have you tried to buy a bag of popcorn at a movie theatre lately??? The theatre cafe is a beautiful bargain of wonderful delights in comparison. Don't miss going to the old Mariinsky!

What a Wonderful Spectacle!. The quality of the dancing was outstanding. With two intervals, it never became stale and tedious. In fact, the story of the Fountain of Bachtiserai was mesmerising - dramatic and scintillating. Brilliant!
Aida - great evening. Beautifully decorated theatre, our cheaper seats still provided an excellent view. Great cultural evening out.

The Best Part of Our Trip to St. Petersburg. Witnessing a ballet in this historic theater was overwhelming. It is lovely, and kept in pristine condition. Most will know it by its Soviet Era name, the Kirov. We were lucky to see a trio of works by the Kirov ballet troupe choreographed by the famous Michael Fokine. Breathtaking, and the highlight of our 5 days in town.

don't miss an evening here!. Whether or not you like opera or ballet you need to go one evening just to experience the athmosphere and the beauty of the theater itself. The Mariinsky is beautiful and elegant, quite an experience. We saw the italian Aida and I managed to stay awake during the whole 4-hours program, it was quite a marathon. Cheap seats are available at the top and they still offer a good view. You don't need to be dressed up, no one checks that. There is food available to buy during intervals but it's very expensive!

The Ballet. My wife had a dream of seeing a ballet by a Russian company. We saw Don Quixote at Mariinsky and were mesmerized. A NYC city woman who had seen it 7 times by other companies around the word said this was so far superior that she was almost speechless. My wife was stunned by the live animals they used as part of the cast. Simply beautiful setting, beautiful production.

A very ordinary performance of RIGOLETTO. Perhaps my expectations were too high but the performance lacked excitement & the set left a lot to be desired. Also the noise of the air-conditioning during the performance proved very distracting. The opera experience did not match the day's attractions. Had we been able to return to the ship before the end of the performance we would certainly done so. (Unfortunately, the driver was picking us up at 2230)
Wonderful. Magnificent theatre. I was surprised at how easy it was to get good tickets on the day - take a box, it's worth it as it's elevated.

Gorgeous theatre. We saw Giselle here - the production was wonderful. The theatre is beautiful - not too large and very European in deign and decoration. You do need to give yourself enough time to find your seats - we were given wrong directions by an usher but eventually found our seats. Cost of seats is not expensive compared to London or other western cities.The ballet itself was the best productionI have seen - the company as a whole is extremely good and Olesya Novikova as Giselle is breathtaking. This is a highlight of the trip to St Petersburg.

Worth a visit! Be sure to buy/order tickets in advance. Mariinsky theater is absolutely worth a visit! It is clear that normal tourists are interested to go there it is one of the must-see spots in St.-Petersburg even if you came for 3-4 days. Be sure to buy/order tickets in advance because it could easily happen that everything is sold out. If you are visiting Mariinsky for the first time take note to visit old building of the theatre not the new one which was build couple of years ago and looks too modern. There are some snacks and drinks available inside but rather pricey, so my advise is to have a dinner afterwards in some restaurant nearby.

Opera. Performance of Turandot superb. The layout though outside the auditorium of Mariinsky 2 is awful for the disabled - up and down stairs and could only find a drink on the top floor with stairs to climb and sit on!
Great ballet at Mariinsky. We saw a ballet (Giselle) at the Mariinsky. Wonderful experience. We were glad we had bought our tickets online about 6 weeks earlier, since the place was packed.

Must see!. One of my favorite memories from my month in St. Petersburg was watching a ballet at this theater! The architecture is incredible and the performance was just as great. Finished off the cultural outing with caviar and champagne during intermission.

Amazing performance. If you like ballet this is the place to come. You can buy very reasonable tickets from their webpage. The performance was beautiful and quite intimate considering you are watching some of the greatest ballet stars in the world. The staff extremely helpful, infact it was one of the only visits in st. Petersburg where we were treated like human beings. The refreshments were expensive, but that is generally the case throughout the city. I fully recommend the experience.

Performances were a trip highlight. We saw an opera and a ballet during our trip. I purchased the tickets on line before leaving home and printed them out. The system worked flawlessly and the staff at the theatre were very helpful.We had very well positioned box seats which were a little tight by American standards but acceptable. We loved the opera we saw (Eugene Onegin) whose final act is set in St Petersburg. We were less enthralled by Swan Lake, which we felt was danced somewhat lethargically in comparison to other performances we have seem.The intermission highlights include champagne and smoked salmon sandwiches in the bars scattered around the theatre. All in all, a lovely experience.
Great Ballet but No Climate Control. Sure, go see a ballet. But expect it to get warm in the theatre. At least that was our experience during July. So dress appropriately.

Beautiful Building Terrible Audience. We ended our full day of sightseeing in the pouring rain by attending a ballet performance at this historic theatre on May 28th. The interior of the theatre is beautiful with several levels of curved boxes adorned with gold leaf that shimmers in the light. There is a very large proscenium with an elaborately decorated show curtain that opens to reveal a huge stage.It's too bad the audience didn't rise to the level of the building. Once the house lights dimmed and the curtain rose the mostly Russian audience continued to talk to each other and take photos and videos on their phones. The lights from the many phones were quite distracting and took away from the beauty of the production.The ballet was in 3 acts and as we needed to return to our ship by a certain time we knew we would not be able to stay through the whole performance as the 2 intermissions lasted for over an hour. Not wanting to get up in the middle of the 3rd act we decided to move closer to the exit doors where there were extra loose seats available. There was a lovely "ballerina" type girl sitting by the door and I thought she might like our seats as they were much better than hers. I asked her if she spoke English and offered her my seats. The nasty look on her face and extremely dismissive wave of her hands was quite surprising. I then offered the seats to another woman who did not acknowledge that I was even speaking to her. So we left our seats empty and moved to the the seats by the door. I then noticed the 2nd woman moving into our seats so I guess she understood what I had said to her.The third act was still going on when we had to exit the theatre and it was quite difficult to find the door-handle and turn it in the dark. It was not a push bar as required in the US.Once we were in the inner lobby we found all the exit doors locked. After trying several doors one of the ushers who were sitting there pointed to the last door which was open. We then found all of the outer lobby doors to be locked with heavy chains around them with the only door open being one at the opposite end of the lobby. After exiting the theatre we began to think about the fact that we were in a huge building filled with wooden furniture, draperies and hundreds of people while all the doors were chained shut. Not a pleasant feeling.Our driver picked us up in the still pouring rain and returned us to the ship.We were quite happy when the ship pulled away from the dock and left Russia behind.

Beautiful theater. We didn't see a show, but took a tour of the theater. It is quite big and impressive. It was built by the same architect who built the Bolshoi in Moscow, this is a lot bigger. Tons of history

AN OPERA HOUSE THAT TURNS YOU.... The legendary Mariinsky Theatre, the home of so many great operatic Stars is surely the best, or at least one of the best Opera Houses in the World. Offering ca 350 performances (if not more) per year! All performances I have had the pleasure to witness were amazing - very well casted and in beautiful sets and costumes. I had the pleasure to see concerts in the acoustical masterpiece- The Mariinsky Concert Hall, seen the new Mariinsky- the gigantic and truly overwhelming superlative opera theatre and of course my absolute favourite- a MUST for every St Petersburg visitor whether a fan of classical music or not: the historical Mariinsky! I am 100% sure: even if you have never liked opeta or ballett, after seeing ANYTHING in this theatre you will be captive- for life!If you have a chance: go to see a ballet and an opera and also a concert. The theatre has a very good functioning website to purchase tickets online (very unlike other theatres in the country).

So lucky to have been there.... We've been to the ballet in the US several times and we thought we had seen good productions, but when we sat there mesmerized at Swan Lake at the Mariinsky, we realized that this is how ballet is meant to be enjoyed.

The history. It's history, you enter the place and you breath history, you look at the theater and it's history when you watch a performance you feel it, it's history. The feeling this place leaves you it's unique

Best Views from the Audience. Any music enthusiast should see this renowned theater. I was fortunate enough to see both a ballet and a concert (led by Maestro Gergiev!) during my stay. The Mariinsky's architecture and decoration is almost as much of a highlight as the productions, and well worth seeing. The "old" Mariinsky theater and the new are right next to one another. The concert hall is about a 5 minute walk from these two. Be sure to check that you are in the right place.

Gorgeous . If you want a real Russian theater experience this is for you. The theater itself is worth seeing and the performances are top notch. Don't forget to get your traditional champagne and chocolate (or caviar) at intermission!

A lovely venue to see anything!. We arranged for rather inexpensive seats to see a really odd opera, For the Love of Three Oranges. The opera was about a prince dying of a hypochondrial disease who will die if he does not laugh--and ends up cursed by a witch to fall in love with three oranges. Yes, it was that odd! But we went to enjoy the amazing theatre and the tickets were dirt cheap! We would love to have seen a ballet, but it was 10x the price for worse seats. Buy tickets yourself on-line (easy to do) and print them up before you go.

Wonderful old theatre, full of character - and amazing ballet. We spent an evening at the Mariinsky watching three one-act ballets - Chopiniana, In The Night, Marguerite and Armand (originally composed for Nureyev and Fonteyn) - and also watching the audience and admiring this magical theatre. It's wonderfully old-fashioned and traditional - individual chairs to sit on, lots of the original boxes for seating in several of the five (!) circles, loads of separate tiny bars for each floor, individual chandeliers providing much of the lighting, big bouquets for the principal dancers at the end of each piece and for the conductor or accompanist. Fairly upmarket and pricey too, with champagne and strawberries and rich gateaux in the intervals. Lots of the audience were dressed-up, particularly in the expensive seats in the stalls, though you don't feel out of place if you're more casually dressed. And the ballet is superb of course, as you'd expect, as is the full orchestra. It's worth remembering to take binoculars or opera glasses if you've got them, though.... the various circles are some way from the stage.

A must if you like ballet. Mariinsky Theatre (I-old)Beautiful old theatre built in 1860 and still glorious. This is the home of the Kirov Ballet. The orchestra (stalls) seating is on individual wooden chairs. We were in the first level above, just slightly higher than the heads in the orchestra section, so we saw very well. We were there in late June, during the “Festival of the White Nights” and saw “Sylvia,” choreographed by Louis Mérante to music by Léo Delibes. Just Lovely.A tip. As we were staying at the Holiday Inn St.Petersburg-Moskovskiye Vorota, about 5.5 km away, we took a K-350 bus at a cost of 34 rubles. The K-350 stops in front of the hotel and in front of the Mariinsky Theatre. (Taxis were charging 700 to 800 rubles.)
Great experience. Must do, specially with school age kids... My daughter loved ballet "Selfida" and all experience. Theatre was packed with people of different age group.
Try and get to a show here.. The theatre building is quite ornate inside although not as much as the Bolshoi in Moscow.We saw La Sylphide which was a beautiful production.
beautiful in every perspective. one of the most beautiful buildings in St. Petersburg. beautiful in every perspective; from inside or from outside.

Acoustic stunner. I saw a opera, booked early online so not expensive. Wow most spectacular performance. The Tsars wife. Did not understand but seriously powerful. its small and intimate and very powerful to watch.
Cinderella - WOW. I was blown away. Didn't even want to go. What a great performance of an updated version of this classic. And the comic relief was wonderful. Also great acoustics.

Lovely ballet. We saw the recent performance of Swan Lake. The principal dancers were outstanding. Costuming was gorgeous. We don't usually have access to top notch ballet in our area so this was a treat.

Swan Lake. One of the finest and most impressive live performances I have ever seen. I not a connoisseur with ballet and dance and I found the experience to be incredibly moving, with the nostalgia of course of being inside the Mariinsky Theatre in St. Petersburg. One for the bucket list peoples. Highly recommend.

Lovely experience. As a former ballet dancer, there was nothing more special than visiting the theater and watching a ballet. Unfortunately I couldn't do the same at the Bolshoi in Moscow, but the Maryinsk experience was amazing!

Classical. We visited the Mariinsky in May and purchased tickets online through the official theatre website. These are cheaper than many of the 'agency' websites that purport to be genuine. There is a two tiered price structure for locals vs visitors to keep in mind. There were times during the booking process that 'Google translator' helped but the eTickets arrived via email and worked on the night!

Beautiful ballet. We saw La Sylphide in the old theatre. The tickets were pricey, but it was a wonderful evening. The Russian ladies really dress up to go to the theatre! The interior is very beautiful and of course the dancing was first class! Do go to watch the ballet when you visit this city.

The Kirov ballet's home. Although we walked past the old Mariinski theater, we attended a full length Kirov performance at the NEW Mariinsky. Do attend the ballet if it is performing. The new theater is nice, but nothing really sets it apart from other similar venues architecturally.

Old world but inconvenient. We went to see A ballet "midnight night dream"as gusts we paid 3 to 4 times more than the locals but the offered and actually sent a driver to the hotel for pickup and returnprograms are only $1! the theater is in a 19th centaury magnificent building the décor is superbbut the sitting is impossible all chairs are old not fixed to the ground have no arms so when the theater is full (normally) people are sitting one on the other very very congested unpleasant and very inconvenient!as in many old theaters no air condition so even in a cool summer day it was hot too hotwhat happens if it is a warm day (there may be a few even in St. Petersburgthe inconvenience of the sitting is killing most of the fun regrettable!!
Just beautiful. The inside is amazing We saw Swan Lake here and it was the most perfect evening.i cannot find anything to dislike about visiting here.
Mariinsky 2. Saw Il Trovatore here. The singing was alright but the production was so dark and bland and colourless that the evening was almost ruined. Bring back the gay!

An art lover's paradise. Went to the old Mariinsky theatre for ballet, to the new Mariinsky for an incredible performance with the entire symphony and Maestro Gergiev and also to the Mariinsky concert hall - heard the world premiere of Richard Danielpour's new symphony, also conducted by Maestro Gergiev - all in all, an amazing few days of music and culture! Hope to get back there one day!

Great Ballet. kirov ballet with full orchestra and choir performing Mendelson's middsummer Nights Dream.performed in an classic old Russian theater with great acoustics. Magical. buy tickets directly from the theaters website and you'll pay half price

Wonderful Experience. Wonderful time in watching A Midsummer Night Dream but the experience in being in the theater itself was worth the price of admission.People putting on their best attire for the ballet, collecting together in the waiting room while some order champagne and caviar, is normally not seen outside of Europe. Seats on the ground floor were regular chairs and not the modern sofa types you normally see.Worth the experience.

Unrivaled ballet theater. The exterior of the building is not a masterpiece, but rather a poor match to the talent of the theater`s dancers. The green color of the building is not the best choice either. However, the interior is spectacular.Talking about the ballet dancers - UNRIVALED.I have seen ballets in NYC, Paris, Berlin, ect. but Mariinsky team is a different class. Btw, I saw Swan Lake there.

The old Kirov. Unmissable. The new building, a must.. The new theatre is Italian style but with wood and amazing onyx interiors. It is airy and modern. It is a music house that has stunning acoustics. The quality of the singing is sublime.
One of the best.. That's one of the best theaters in the world. Even if you're not a fan of ballet, take a try, feel yourself a real sir;) don't forget the bars during the brake)

Big tick off the bucket list. I had always dreamed of seeing a ballet at the Mariinsky and I'm delighted to say that it lived up to every expectation. We saw a performance of Anna Karenina, which was a perfect if not conventional choice. Getting the tickets was fairly traumatic - we went to the theatre and stood in the queue for a good hour, gradually getting closer to the ticket office until we made it to the front, when an announcement was made (in Russian). Everyone abruptly moved to the next ticket office and the ticket booth window was slammed in our faces, so we had to move to the back of the same queue we'd just made it to the front of!Nevertheless, we got our tickets and the performance was worth it. The theatre is exquisitely beautiful, there was a live orchestra, which was a real treat and the ballet was the stuff of a little girl's dreams.

Stunning, Wonderful, Simply Great!. We were here on June 7th 2014 to watch the Don Quixote ballet. Two days before we were in the Bolshoi in Moscow to have a comparison. Both compare very well to each other and not to much else in the world. In this case the ballet was excellent, perfect, interesting, not boring for a minute, very good music, all actors very good, with incredibly solos, in particular by Kim Kimin. If you visit St Petersburg and like ballet: Go by all means! As for the theatre building itself: Great of course.Grab a good seat of course. We were sitting in parkett, which was very good. Catering is also not bad and sensibly priced.

Watch ballet students excel in a truly old-World setting. We took ten- dollar seats at the top of the old Marinsky at their School's graduation and saw over 100 students, all very precise and well- trained, perform for their friends and family. Outstanding full orchestra!
Sylvia. We saw a beautiful classic ballet "Sylvia". Worth a visit! We had great seats in the Tsar box which made the event even more memorable
